info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:58PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA... SOUTHEASTERN WESTMORELAND AND EASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM EDT... At 1057 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near East Conemaugh to 6 miles northwest of Seven Springs to near Perryopolis. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Connellsville, South Connellsville, Farmington, Perryopolis, Ligonier, Seven Springs, Dunbar, Everson, Vanderbilt, Dawson, Markleysburg, Laurel Mountain, Donegal, Chalkhill, Champion, Ohiopyle, Mill Run, Indian Head, Acme, and Jones Mills. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 87 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for southwestern and west central Pennsylvania...and northeastern West Virginia.
